title: Gender Violence
description: A friend of yours suffered an incident of domestic violence and asks you to help her with her children for a couple of weeks.
prompt: How do you want to help her?

options.description: Take time off work to help her
options.implicationText: If you choose this option, your boss allows you to change the hours with your partner, but you will have to make up the hours, doing 5 hours a week for 2 extra weeks. 9% of migrants have to request help from the community, this also serves to create a community network in Ecuador.

learn_more: One in two migrant women in Ecuador has suffered or is suffering gender violence in the domestic or public space.

title: Stay or Leave?
description: Unfortunately, you have not managed to integrate economically and socially into Ecuador. You decide to return to Venezuela in a few months.
prompt: What do you want to do?

options.description: Go to the border between Ecuador and Colombia
options.implicationText: You have been left without a job, and there are no expectations of earning an income. A humanitarian organization supports with the payment of the tickets to the Ecuador-Colombia border, with a return aid. It may be a time to return to Venezuela. 23% of migrants are forced to return to Venezuela for not meeting their objectives in their migration process. Migrants are the hope of the relatives who remain in Venezuela to receive remittances and to be able to access basic needs with dignity.

options.description: Go to the border between Ecuador and Peru
options.implicationText: You have been left without a job, and there are no expectations of earning an income. A humanitarian organization supports the payment of tickets to the Ecuador-Peru border, with transit assistance. It may be a time to try somewhere else.

learn_more: During the time in Ecuador, not all migrants who had the objective integrating achieve their objective. The impossibility of settling in Ecuador is due to different factors such as: being victims of gender violence, victims of attacks due to xenophobia, lack of livelihoods due to their nationality, lack of secure networks. The challenges they face in their day to day generate crucial decision-making, which will have an impact on the success or otherwise of their immigration process.

title: Eviction
description: Your landlord decides to evict you for not paying your rent.
prompt: What do you want to do?

options.implicationText: You move with your family to one of the 50 active shelters supported by the WFP in Ecuador. You are entitled to the maximum 5 days of assistance. 46% of the migrant population report poor accommodations and 9% report a lack of basic services.

options.description: Share a home with another family
options.implicationText: You decide to move to a private room, with kitchen and hygiene facilities shared with other families. 33% of the migrant population share their home with other family nuclei. 21% consider their bathrooms or showers unsafe.

learn_more: 51% of family groups have been forced to move since they arrived in Ecuador. 46% report having had problems with the owner of the house/room and 23% have suffered discrimination due to their nationality.
